title: Noatak National Preserve: Park Home
body: Wilderness Adventure  As one of North America's largest mountain-ringed river basins with an intact ecosystem, the Noatak River environs features some of the Arctic's finest arrays of plants and animals. The river is classified as a national wild and scenic river, and offers stunning wilderness float-trip opportunities - from deep in the Brooks Range to the tidewater of the Chukchi Sea.                The Noatak River   Flanked by the Delong and Baird mountains of the Brooks Range, the river offers 280 miles of superlative wilderness float-trip opportunities        Living off the Land   Today - as in the past - the land provides for local families.  They rely on fish, berries and wildlife to sustain their culture.              Calling All Junior Rangers!   Become a Junior Ranger at Noatak National Preserve! Join us at a program or play along at home.        Explore the Backcountry!   Explore the backcountry by camping and hiking in Noatak National Preserve's untouched wilderness.
